intro: Persoonia surrecta, commonly known as the tall pincushion. It is a flowering plant native to Australia, characterized by its erect, spiny stems and dense, spherical clusters of yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the family Proteaceae and is adapted to grow in sandy soils and dry environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, leathery leaves that help reduce water loss. Persoonia surrecta is often cultivated for its ornamental value and unique appearance.
